column4: hello! anyone knows how to restore a usb disk drive firmware?
i'd ask in #hardware
my thougts precisely, but apparently it is invitation only :S
really?
that's what freenode said when i tried to join...
you just need to be registered
ask in #ubuntu+1 for Precise support please
i'm already there. but my question is more general, ie, is there any way to save the kernel buffer if the kernel is locking up before initializing anything?
your quesion is regarding Precise which isn't supported here until release day
or more simply, how do i report bugs in the kernel boot process?
... a simple "i have no idea" would have been helpful. i know how to file bugs, i need to know how to o something needed for the bug report.
the bot told you
or ask in #ubuntu+1

dude. you are not reading my question. this is not a question about ubuntu+1. this is a uestion about filing bugs, but not a general type of question. the question is: how do i produce error reports to include in the bug that i alredy know how to fill that occurs in the kernel boot process
ubuntu-bug linux     should kick off the process
in other words, does anyone here know how to save kernel boot messages? bootlogd is not working either, as the error occurs before it gets started.
/var/log/dmesg*  maybe, one may be the last boot, the guys managing the bugs can advise how to get what they need
yeah, i guess i'll file it as is, and then see how to produce errors. i just thougth that  was a rather common thing.
that's what I was getting at :). Remember Ubuntu's target audience :D
FYI, if any other peep comes along with a similar question, it seems we have pretty thorough how-tos on reporting esoteric kernel bugs: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingKernelBoot
nice :)
